page.title: 16The Story of Wem Baths
page.content: There is a swimming pool in Wem down Bowen's Field.The local people had the idea of building it in 1969. Many clubs and individuals helped raise the money over a period of five years. The pool is 25 metres long and 10 metres wide. The Wem Town Council took over the pool in 1974 because it was so expensive to run. Everyone in Wem has been upset to see it shut after their hard work.It shut in 1982 because it had a very poor flat roof and water came in rusting the metal beams. It was a long time before anyone spotted this so eventually the whole roof needed replacing. This has been an expensive job, costing many times more than the original building,and the architects and council still have not been able to agree who is responsible. It has taken over 3 years to put right but should open in August this year.
